todos.title: Performance Goals and Learning Goals
todos.body: You should have goals to perform and goals to build skills so you can perform better.

todos.title: Currency
todos.body: What we have to offer other people.  Finding your currency doesn’t come from looking within but looking outwards at what other people need and then determining what you have to provide them.  You cannot find out other people’s needs unless they are willing to be vulnerable and candid with you.

todos.title: Eastern v. Western Cultures
todos.body: Westerners tend to prefer individualization, logic, and analytical thinking.  Easterners tend to prefer dialectical thought, holism, and collective farming.

todos.title: Mortality Salience
todos.body: We project our fear of death into normal events such as business goals, meetings, speeches, etc.

todos.title: Argue for Truth
todos.body: The closest you can get to Truth with a capital T, not for victory or comfort.

todos.title: Sparring
todos.body: Taking your support partners outside their comfort zone.

todos.title: Sustainable Help Programs
todos.body: Require group support and accountability.

todos.title: Day-Righting
todos.body: Putting heads together at beginning of each day to figure out what needs to be done.

todos.title: Purpose of Lifeline Relationships
todos.body: Identify what success means, create plan, create an “anti-plan” (what we shouldn’t be doing), support, and accountability.

todos.title: Career Coach & Therapist
todos.body: Hire both to help you through your personal/professional life.

todos.title: Four Mindsets of Lifeline Relationships
todos.body: Generosity (trusting), Vulnerability (letting guard down), Candor (honesty), Accountability (following through).

todos.title: Relationship Strategies
todos.body: Form tribes of skilled workers, Social media is not a true relationship, Work with people you would be friends with, Build strong relationships with your team, and Trust your team.

todos.title: Intuition
todos.body: Follow your gut.

todos.title: Avoid Personal Attacks
todos.body: Focus on behavior not person.

todos.title: Safe Place
todos.body: Constructive feedback should be given in a safe private place.

todos.title: Compromise v. Collaboration
todos.body: Compromise requires that each member give something up.  Collaboration means that you can develop a solution where neither have to sacrifice something and all can come out ahead.

todos.title: Lifeline Relationships
todos.body: At least three to twelve relationships between equals, peers, individuals who can be sparring partners and confidants.  Age does not matter.

todos.title: Get Feedback
todos.body: Ask other people for candor.  Beg for it if necessary.

todos.title: Define Greatness
todos.body: Act like you’ve got it figured out and let people follow.

todos.title: Tutu Relationship Rule
todos.body: “A person is a person through other persons.” - Archbishop Desmund Tutu

todos.title: Post Hoc Fallacy
todos.body: You go to your doctor and say I have an ear problem, your doctor looks at your nose.  You tell your doctor its an ear problem, and your doctor says, yes, your nose is connected to your ear.  Humans are bad at determining cause and effect.

todos.title: Diverse Relationships
todos.body: Work with people from many different fields.

todos.title: Don’t Sugarcoat
todos.body: Warren Buffet bases investment decisions on whether he thinks managers are sugarcoating problems.

todos.title: Leave Prejudices Behind
todos.body: Walk into every meeting regardless of the past and think here is someone I could care about.

todos.title: Vulnerabiltiy
todos.body: The more you talk about your fears, the more people will want to help you with them.  Vulnerability builds trust.  Share personal information or invite people to your home or a meaningful location.  Revisit your past.

todos.title: Candor
todos.body: Tell people the truth.  If you don’t it will seep out or erupt at the worst time possible.  Don’t meander.  Be blunt.  Give feedback face-to-face in private.  Praise in public.  Soften your candor.  Don’t give it to people when they are stressed or you are angry.  Ask how things are in their lives.  Show them you care.  Tell them you don’t blame them personally for it.

todos.title: Hot Topic Meetings
todos.body: Sitting in a room and talking about current events, gossip, hearsay, and sharing who knows who.  Method of using soft data to extend everyone’s reach.

todos.title: Never sell alone
todos.body: Sell in groups.

todos.title: Active Listening
todos.body: Repeating back what the person just said to you.

todos.title: Questions
todos.body: Relationship building requires asking a thousand questions to get to know the other person and establish their currency.

todos.title: Relationship Action Plan
todos.body: People you need to have a strong relationship with.  Record their problems so that you can continue to help and understand them.

todos.title: Joint Research Laboratory
todos.body: Partner with other companies for research.

todos.title: Company to Company Networking
todos.body: Invite another company to a company-to-company engagement.

todos.title: Anti-Relationships
todos.body: Identify the people who you should stay away from.

todos.title: Affective Forecasting
todos.body: Humans are terrible at forecasting how future events will make us feel.

todos.title: Socratic Method
todos.body: Help people by providing a good process and not an answer.  There’s seldom ever one correct answer.

todos.title: Practice Every Day
todos.body: Have your key set of skills that you want to practice every day.

todos.title: Clients kids
todos.body: Focus on your clients kids and see if you can setup internships for them.

todos.title: 50/50 Rule
todos.body: Fifty percent of job should be to help the company you are serving and fifty percent should be helping those people that actually hire you.

todos.title: Stories
todos.body: Explain your passions through stories.  Good stories can dissolve emotional boundaries.  Best way to change someone’s opinion is to tell them or make up a good story about why it should be done your way so that they think you are acting off experience and not opinion.

todos.title: I’ve Got Your Back
todos.body: End conversations with “what can I help you with and you know I got your back”.

todos.title: Long Slow Dinner
todos.body: Dinner meetings are more personal than lunch because there is not a set time.  Lifeline relationship people meet for more than one hour.

todos.title: The “It” ant the “Anti-It”
todos.body: Create plans and lists to help your company and also create anti-plans and anti-lists that are things that your company should avoid like the plague.

todos.title: Accept Help/Obligatory Interdependence
todos.body: By accepting help you are helping others to feel valuable and needed.  People like people more whom they have invested in and done good things for.  People want to help.

todos.title: Exit Strategy
todos.body: Build everything with an escape plan in mind.  When you exit, exit quick.

todos.title: Accountability
todos.body: Broadcast the things that you want yourself and others to be held accountable for.  Get an accountability buddy who is removed from your day-to-day routine.  Join support group.

todos.title: BFM
todos.body: Big fucking moment.  Sharing in the success of one of your colleagues.

todos.title: Contract E-mails
todos.body: Avoid e-mails that imply all do this for you if you do this for me.  Put some time between give and take.  Even if it is several years or forever.

todos.title: Focus First on Relationship
todos.body: Americans are too quick to jump to agenda during meetings.  Take the first part of every meeting to strengthen the relationship (generosity, vulnerability, candor, accountability).
